question: The deadly nightshade you slipped me wore off, Sally.
answer: Let go!

question: You're not ready for so much excitement!
answer: Yes I am!

question: You're coming with me!
answer: No I'm not!

question: Jack, I know how you feel.
answer: Sally, you've come back.

question: I had to.
answer: For this?

question: Yes.
answer: Shall we then. That's twice this month you've slipped deadly nightshade into my tea and run off --

question: Three times!
answer: You're mine you know! I made you with my own hands.

question: You can make other creations. I'm restless, I can't help it.
answer: It's a phase my dear, it'll pass. We need to be patient that's all.

question: Where are we? It's someplace new.
answer: bark bark

question: What is this?
answer: bark bark

question: Stand aside.
answer: grrrr

question: Coming through. We've got find Jack. There's only 365 days left till next Halloween.
Frog's breath will overpower any odor. Bitter. Worm's wart. Where's that worm's wart?
answer: Sally, that soup ready yet?

question: Coming....lunch
answer: Ah, what's that? Worm's wart, mmm, and...frog's breath.

question: What's wrong? I-I thought you liked frog's breath.
answer: Nothing's more suspicious than frog's breath. Until you taste it I won't swallow a spoonful.

question: I'm not hungry... Oops!
answer: You want me to starve. An old man like me who hardly has strength as it is. Me, to whom you owe your very life.

question: Where have you been?
answer: Call a town meeting and I'll tell everyone all about it.

question: When?
answer: Immediately!

question: Town meeting, town meeting, town meeting tonight, town meeting tonight
answer: Listen everyone. I want to tell you about Christmastown. There are objects so peculiar They were not to be believed All around, things to tantalize my brain It's a world unlike anything I've ever seen And as hard as I try I can't seem to describe Like a most improbable dream But you must believe when I tell you this It's as real as my skull and it does exist Here, let me show you

question: Everyone, please now, not so fast There's something here that you don't quite grasp Well, I may as well give them what they want And the best, I must confess, I have saved for the last For the ruler of this Christmas land Is a fearsome king with a deep mighty voice Least that's what I've come to understand There's got to be a logical way to explain this Xmas thing.
answer: You've poisoned me for the last time you wretched girl. Oh my head...the door is open.

question: Hel-lo
answer: Jack Skellington, up here my boy.

question: Dr. I need to borrow some equipment.
answer: Is that so, whatever for?

question: I'm conducting a series of experiments.
answer: How perfectly marvelous. Curiosity killed the cat, you know.

question: I know.
answer: Come on into the lab and we'll get you all fixed up.

question: Jack said we should work together Three of a kind First, we're going to set some bait Inside a nasty trap and wait When he comes a-sniffing we will Snap the trap and close the gate
answer: Wait! I've got a better plan To catch this big red lobster man Let's pop him in a boiling pot And when he's done we'll butter him up

question: Then Mr. Oogie Boogie Man Can take the whole thing over then He'll be so pleased, I do declare That he will cook him rare
answer: I say that we take a cannon Aim it at his door And then knock three times And when he answers Sandy Claws will be no more

question: Fantastic! Now why don't you all practice on that and we'll be in great shape. Sally, I need your help more than anyone's.
answer: You certainly do, Jack. I had the most terrible vision.

question: That's splendid.
answer: No, it was about your Xmas. There was smoke and fire.

question: That not my Xmas. My Xmas is filled with laughter and joy and this--my Sandy Claws outfit. I want you to make it.
answer: Jack, please, listen to me--it's going to be a disaster.

question: How could it be--just follow the pattern. This part is red, the trim is white.
answer: It's a mistake, Jack.

question: Let's have a cheer from everyone It's time to party
answer: I don't believe what's happening to me My hopes, my dreams, my fantasies Hee, hee, hee, hee Hmm, my compliments from me to you On this your most intriguing hat Consider though this substitute A bat in place of this old rat Huh! No, no, no, now that's all wrong This thing will never make a present It's been dead now for much too long Try something fresher, something pleasant Try again, don't give up

question: This time, this time
answer: It's ours!

question: Making Christmas, making Christmas La, la, la It's almost here 'Cause when the full moon starts to climb We'll all sing out
answer: It's Christmastime Hee, hee, hee

question: You don't look like yourself Jack, not at all.
answer: Isn't that wonderful. It couldn't be more wonderful!

question: But you're the Pumpkin King.
answer: Not anymore. And I feel so much better now.

question: Jack, I know you think something's missing. But -- Sorry
answer: You're right, something is missing but what? I've got the beard, the coat, the boots --

question: Let me out!
answer: Sandy Claws in person. What a pleasure to meet you. Why you have hands! You don't have claws at all.

question: Where am I?
answer: Surprised aren't you? I knew you would be. You don't need to have another worry about Xmas this year.

question: What?
answer: Consider this a vacation Sandy, a reward. It's your turn to take it easy.

question: But there must be some mistake!
answer: See that he's comfortable. Just a second fellows. Of course, that's what I'm missing.

question: But --
answer: Thanks!

question: You just can't... Hold on where are we going now?
answer: ho ho ho

question: No Zero, down boy. My what a brilliant nose you have. The better to light my way! To the head of the team, Zero! We're off!
answer: Wait Jack, no!

question: ho ho ha ha ha
answer: Good bye Jack, my dearest Jack. Oh how I hope my premonition is wrong.

question: ho ho ho ho ho ho he he he Merry Xmas! And what is your name? That's all right. I have a special present for you anyway. There you go sonny. Hohohohehehe Merry Xmas! hohohohehehe You're welcome one and all!
answer: Jack, someone has to help Jack. Where'd they take that Sandy Claws?

question: He'll fix things Jack. He knows what to do.
answer: How did you get down here Sally?

question: Oh, I was trying to, well, I wanted to, to --
answer: to help me

question: I couldn't just let you just...
answer: Sally, I can't believe I never realized...that you...
